abstract: A component that supports general image presentation.
overview:
## Overview

`ImagePresentationComponent` supports the presentation of three different kinds of images in RealityKit:

To present a 2D image or a spatial photo, create a new `ImagePresentationComponent` from a local file URL for the existing image, or from an existing `CGImageSource`.

To generate and present a spatial scene from an existing image, create a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/Spatial3DImage] from the image; call the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/Spatial3DImage/generate()] method on your new spatial 3D image; then create a new `ImagePresentationComponent` with [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/init(spatial3DImage:)].

### Viewing modes

By default, an `ImagePresentationComponent` presents its image in a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/ViewingMode-swift.struct/mono] viewing mode, regardless of what kind of image you create it with.

To request a different viewing mode, set the component’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/desiredViewingMode] property, and add the component to an entity with the updated value.

To discover which viewing modes a component’s image supports, query the component’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/availableViewingModes] property. The [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/availableViewingModes] set always contains [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/ViewingMode-swift.struct/mono] as an option.

When you create this component with a valid spatial photo, the set of available viewing modes also contains [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/ViewingMode-swift.struct/spatialStereo] and [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/ViewingMode-swift.struct/spatialStereoImmersive].

If you created the component with a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/Spatial3DImage], and have called the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/Spatial3DImage/generate()] method to generate it, the set of available viewing modes will also contain [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/ViewingMode-swift.struct/spatial3D] and [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/ViewingMode-swift.struct/spatial3DImmersive].
rawMarkdown:
---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent
crawled: 2025-12-02T19:51:41Z
---

# ImagePresentationComponent

**Structure**

A component that supports general image presentation.

## Declaration

```swift
struct ImagePresentationComponent
```

## Overview

`ImagePresentationComponent` supports the presentation of three different kinds of images in RealityKit:

- A traditional 2D image.
- A *spatial photo*, which is a stereoscopic photo with additional spatial metadata, as captured on iPhone 15 Pro or later and Apple Vision Pro.
- A *spatial scene*, which is a 3D image generated from an existing 2D image or photo.

To present a 2D image or a spatial photo, create a new `ImagePresentationComponent` from a local file URL for the existing image, or from an existing `CGImageSource`.

To generate and present a spatial scene from an existing image, create a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/Spatial3DImage] from the image; call the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/Spatial3DImage/generate()] method on your new spatial 3D image; then create a new `ImagePresentationComponent` with [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/init(spatial3DImage:)].

### Viewing modes

By default, an `ImagePresentationComponent` presents its image in a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/ViewingMode-swift.struct/mono] viewing mode, regardless of what kind of image you create it with.

To request a different viewing mode, set the component’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/desiredViewingMode] property, and add the component to an entity with the updated value.

To discover which viewing modes a component’s image supports, query the component’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/availableViewingModes] property. The [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/availableViewingModes] set always contains [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/ViewingMode-swift.struct/mono] as an option.

When you create this component with a valid spatial photo, the set of available viewing modes also contains [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/ViewingMode-swift.struct/spatialStereo] and [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/ViewingMode-swift.struct/spatialStereoImmersive].

If you created the component with a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/Spatial3DImage], and have called the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/Spatial3DImage/generate()] method to generate it, the set of available viewing modes will also contain [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/ViewingMode-swift.struct/spatial3D] and [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ImagePresentationComponent/ViewingMode-swift.struct/spatial3DImmersive].



## Creating a component from a 2D image or spatial photo

- **init(contentsOf:)**: Creates a new component by loading a monoscopic texture and (if present) a pair of spatial textures from the provided image file URL.
- **init(imageSource:)**: Creates a new component by loading a monoscopic texture and (if present) a pair of spatial textures from the provided image source.

## Creating a component from a spatial scene

- **ImagePresentationComponent.Spatial3DImage**: A 3D spatial scene created from a 2D image.
- **init(spatial3DImage:)**: Creates a new image presentation component to present a spatial 3D image.

## Setting and discovering viewing modes

- **ImagePresentationComponent.ViewingMode**: Image content’s rendering mode.
- **viewingMode**: The currently active viewing mode of the presented image.
- **desiredViewingMode**: The user-selected preferred content viewing mode.
- **availableViewingModes**: The currently valid viewing modes for the image being presented.
- **supportedViewingModes(for:)**: The viewing modes supported by the provided image source.

## Retrieving the current image size

- **aspectRatio(for:)**: The aspect ratio of the image this component will present for the requested viewing mode.
- **screenImageDimension**: The image resolution of the currently presented image, in pixels.

## Retrieving the current screen mesh size

- **screenHeight**: The height of the screen mesh, in meters, when the image is presented in a non-immersive viewing mode.
- **presentationScreenSize**: The size of the screen presenting the image, with the format [width, height] in meters.

## Type Methods

- **supportedViewingModes(for:)**: The viewing modes supported by the provided image source.

## Visual adjustments

- **HoverEffectComponent**: A component that applies a visual effect to a hierarchy of entities when a person looks at or selects an entity.
- **BillboardComponent**: A component that orients an entity instance so that it continuously points toward the active camera.
- **EnvironmentBlendingComponent**: A component that controls how an entity blends visually with objects in the local environment.
- **LensDistortionData**: A description of estimated lens distortion that can be used to rectify images.

## Conforms To

- Component
